tasks.instruction: Create a comprehensive system design document for the habit tracker and job aggregator web application based on the detailed requirements. Include architecture diagrams, component relationships, data flow, and database schema. Focus on the MVP features first, but provide architecture that can accommodate the Nice-to-have and Pro/Startup Level features in the future.

Implement the full-stack habit tracker and job aggregator web application according to the system design document created by Bob. Follow the specified technology stack: Frontend using HTML5, CSS3 with Tailwind CSS, JavaScript (React.js), and Chart.js; Backend using Node.js, Express.js, Axios, Cheerio, and node-cron; Storage using LocalStorage and JSON/SQLite; and Export functionality using SheetJS. Implement the MVP features first: Habit & Progress Tracker, Local Storage Persistence, Job Scraper Service, Job List UI, and Data Export. Use the specified file structure and include beginner-friendly comments.

Implement the "Nice-to-have" features for the habit tracker and job aggregator web application based on the existing codebase:
1. Gamification: Add streak counters, milestone badges (e.g., '7-Day Consistency Champ'), and confetti animations when daily goals are hit.
2. Charts & Visualization: Implement weekly/monthly progress charts using Chart.js.
3. Motivational Boost: Add daily randomized motivational quote or coding tip.
4. Polished UI: Enhance the UI with modern, card-based design, soft shadows, rounded edges, and smooth animations.
5. Job Filters: Add the ability to filter jobs by keyword, location, or company before showing them in the UI.

Continue using the same technology stack and ensure all new code has beginner-friendly comments.
